intro: Phaca domeykoana, commonly known as the Domeyko's phaca, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
